title: Getting Started: Experiential Learning
description: Are you expecting to work in your major field when you graduate? Employers look for graduates with experience. Learn how to gain such related experience while in school through internships, co-ops, and service learning.

title: UCF's Perceptions of Hazing
description: Join us in a workshop where we will engage in interactive scenarios that will fully engage your critical thinking skills. This workshop will not only challenge your own perceptions of what is hazing but also provide you with information on UCFâ€™s hazing policies and protocols. By the end of this workshop, you will be equipped with the knowledge and tools necessary to react to any hazing behavior you may encounter. Â

title: Refugee and Immigrant Simulation
description:
The School of Social Work invites members of the campus and local communities toÂ participate in a Refugee SimulationÂ at Memory Mall on March 28, 2017, from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.

The Refugee Simulation will offer individuals an opportunity to walk in the shoes of immigrant and refugee populations. The simulation will include a camp withÂ multiple tents set up to demonstrate the living conditions of refugees andÂ the food andÂ supplies they receive.

Participants will begin by entering a check-in tent where they will receive an identity card that describes who they are and where they're from.

Social work students andÂ faculty members -- along with members of Catholic Charities Refugee ResettlementÂ of Central FloridaÂ -- will be on hand to share information and suggest ways to get involved.

See the event announcement

title: Considering Graduate or Professional School?
description: Explore important issues that should be considered prior to applying to graduate or professional school.

title: CANCELED: FIXING THE PHONE: DESIGNING STRONG AUTHENTICATION FOR TELEPHONY
description: Billions of users trust the telephone network with their most sensitive communications, including commerce, banking, industry, and personal communications.Â These users trust that the telephone network functions reliably despite the fact that telephones are the instrument of billions of dollars of fraud and abuse annually. This fraud is possible because telephony networks, including landline, cellular, and VoIP, have weak or non-existent abilities to identify and authenticate users. In this talk, we will examine how phone networks are being misused for authentication and secure communications.Â We will then see how new systems leveraging techniques from networking, cryptography, and signal processing can provide strong authentication of phone calls. These techniques will pave the way for a more trustworthy telephone infrastructure.

title: Tie-Dye Shirts for Harbor House
description:
VUCF Arts and Recreation week continues with "Tie-Dye Shirts for Harbor House". Harbor House of Central Florida is an innovating organization that guides the way for safer communitiesÂ everywhere byÂ developing, deploying and modeling best practices to eradicateÂ domestic abuse in Central Florida. Harbor House also works to prevent and eliminate domestic abuse in Central FloridaÂ by providingÂ critical life-saving services to survivors, implementing and advancingÂ best practices,Â and educatingÂ and engaging the community in a united front.Â

Volunteer tasks will include making tie-dye shirts for the survivors that reside in the nearest Harbor House location. It is recommended that you wear clothes you do not mind getting dirty. This event will be taking place in the Neptune Multipurpose Room from 1-4PM.Â By the end of this service event, students will understand the mission statement of Harbor House.

To RSVP, please visitÂ https://ucf.collegiatelink.net/organization/vucf/calendar/details/1271791. For more information or additional questions, please contact Brionna Shanae at vucf_arts@ucf.edu

title: Inclusive Communication
description:
Facilitator: Rachel Luce-Hitt

This workshop identifies some common mistakes made when communicating about age, class, disabilities, ethnicity, gender, language, looks, race, religion, and sexual orientation. It also highlights words, phrases, and behaviors that can enhance the process of communicating about and across various dimensions of difference.


RegistrationÂ Instructions

  • Faculty, A&P and USPS: Register online at my.UCF.edu.
  • Students and OPS: Email your name, phone number and PID/employee I.D. number to diverse@ucf.edu.


For more information, visit https://diversity.ucf.edu/training/this-semester.
contact_name: UCF Office of Diversity and Inclusion

title: Tower Garden Workshop
description:
Wellness and Health Promotion Services (WHPS) is proud to offer:
Tower Garden Workshop
Join us to learn life skills associated with growing your own food and maintaining a healthy lifestyle. Â We will meet by the tower garden on the 1st floor of the Student Union (near the stairs). Today we will be harvesting and you will get to take home some free, fresh, organic produce!

title: Before You Do That, Know This
description: "Sure, you can borrow my lab report!" Most students think cheating on a test is the only form of academic misconduct. Learn how UCF actually defines academic misconduct in order to maintain academic integrity. Earn 1,000 LINK points for attending! This event is a part of the College Life Workshop Series hosted by Integrity & Ethical Development.
location: Student Union 221: Student Union Garden Key Meeting Room

title: LGBTQ Employer Panel and Networking Mixer
description:

Refreshments provided!Â

No RSVP required.Â

title: LGBTQ Employer Panel with Career Services
description: LGBTQ+ Services & Career Services presents a panel of local/state employers who identify as or support the LGBTQ+ community.Â Join them as they discuss their experiences and ask questions.

title: CGI U Info Session
description:
Do you have a great new idea on how to make the world a better place? Are you interested in creating lasting social change in your community? If so, then you should apply for CGI U!Â There is still time to apply to CGI U 2017! The final deadline to apply is May 1, 2017 (May 2017 graduates are eligible to apply).

Join us for a CGI U Information Session on March 28th at 4pm in Ferrell Commons 165 (LEAD Scholars Academy Lounge)!

Selected students will receive mentoring, partial funding for the conference trip to the annual CGI U meeting at Northeastern University in Boston, Massachusetts (October 13-15, 2017) AND seed money to help make their social change dream a reality! The meeting will bring together more than 1,000 innovative student leaders to make commitments to action that address some of the worldâ€™s most pressing challenges. Last year, 17 UCF students were accepted.

Please contact Mike McFadden at michael.mcfadden@ucf.edu or 407-823-6957 with any questions. Visit http://cgiu.org/ for more information.

title: Annual Networking Knight
description: Calling all HMI Knights! title: Official ChargeOn Pregame Party
description:
Knights in New York City!Â The NIT Final Four (featuring the Knights!) will be at Madison Square GardenÂ on Tuesday, March 28. Join the New York UCF Alumni Chapter for the official ChargeOn Pregame Party at Carragher's PubÂ before marching over to "The World's Most Famous Arena" together to cheer on UCF Hoops in the NIT semifinals against TCU!

Registered guests will receive two drink tickets per personÂ and UCF Vice President and Director of Athletics Danny White will join us for a pregame pep talk, so don't miss out!

title: Progressive Action General Meeting
description: Progressive Action is a political club focused on advancing the progressive agenda through activism including rallies, protests, phonebanking, and canvassing. Come to our meetings and get politically involved! Be sure to look for our table outside the Student Union on Tuesdays.

title: CAB Presents : Comedy Trivia Knight
description: Come out and test your knowledge on all things comedy. The winning team will receive four movie tickets to Regal Cinema!

title: College Democrats at UCF Meeting
description: Every Tuesday at 7PM in SU218C the College Democrats meet in order to build young progressives into future leaders. Please join us as we plan future events and discuss ways to get involved in the political process. Speakers are announced to our Facebook page, College Democrats at UCF.

title: Alcoholics Anonymous: Actions of Recovery
description:
This meeting is held every Tuesday (unless otherwise noted on the UCF calendar) from 7pm to 8pm at thePoint @ UCF in Research Park: SUITE 135, 12424 Research Pkwy #250, Orlando, FL.

This is a fellowship of men and women who share their experience, strength and hope with one another, that they may solve their common problem and help others to recover from alcoholism. The only requirement for membership is a desire to stop drinking. AA's primary purpose is to stay sober and help other alcoholics to achieve sobriety.

For more information about this meeting visit www.shs.ucf.edu/crc or call the AA Helpline at (800) 331-2900.

title: Tuesday Salsa Class
description:
Located at the Student Union, come have some mid-week fun exploring the Latino culture and making new friends through Salsa dance! You first class is free. Attire is comfortable clothes for dancing in, and you don't need to bring anything special. We look forward to dancing with you!

Sincerely, Latin Rhythm E-Board
location: Student Union: Garden Key Meeting Room (Room 221)
